main event: An unidentified object was observed in Traverse City, Michigan on October 9, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright stationary light that moved in a straight line and then suddenly disappeared., The observation lasted for about 1 hour., The case was later classified as not bona fide due to lack of information., The observer was deemed reliable to the best of the available ability., It was noted that no noise was described during the sighting.
